markdownRemark.html:
To sustain all of our global needs - fruits and vegetables available even if out of season, massive land allocated to produce meat, energy, clothing, construction materials, travel and leisure, technology and research. Most of these needs are sourced out to businesses that operate for a profit - hence. More consumption, more profit, more products, better services - the cycle repeats itself over and over.

I find this very alarming due to the amount of resources needed to sustain our wants and needs. I was watching a short video done by [Climate lab and Vox](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6RlxySFrkIM) on food wastage and to my shock - we throw everyday 40% of the food that we produce. This is still edible! That's crazy!!!

We are approximately 7.7 billion already, growing at a pace of 1.07% per year. It is catastrophic if all humans on earth would try to live like an average american. Experts thinks that we need four earths to accomodate the natural resources needed.

I find it amazing to reflect on the idea of natural selection theorized by Charles Darwin. We came to a point where a specie can create complex systems just to support the population.

But where does this system of capitalism will take us? Judh
